thread.title: The 'Love Actually' sequel will feature more of Andrew Lincoln stalking people
thread.title_full: The 'Love Actually' sequel will feature more of Andrew Lincoln stalking people

author: Sam Haysom
title: The 'Love Actually' sequel will feature more of Andrew Lincoln stalking people
text:
It wouldn't be a Love Actually film without Andrew Lincoln behaving creepily, and it doesn't look like the 10-minute sequel — which has just finished being filmed for Red Nose Day — is going to disappoint.
SEE ALSO: The painful reason Emma Thompson won't be in the Love Actually reunion
Script Editor Emma Freud, who's been live-tweeting behind-the-scenes images from the shoot, shared the following picture Wednesday.
It was 13 years ago. There is more facial hair now. But he still loves her.... #rednosedayactually pic.twitter.com/0Zhz341Jj4
— emma freud (@emmafreud) March 8, 2017
13 years on and he's more bearded and significantly more adept at slaying zombies, but apart from that it's the same old Andrew Lincoln with the same old white signs.
From the looks of Freud's photos, the cast are having a lot of fun with the sequel.
Andrew Lincoln + Cards + Doorstep = Deep Joy #rednosedayactually pic.twitter.com/vXHrJgKY8k
— emma freud (@emmafreud) March 7, 2017
Love still all around on set yesterday. #rednosedayactually pic.twitter.com/zWnhQFqjc6
— emma freud (@emmafreud) March 8, 2017
'I thought you were bringing the boards?' #RedNoseDayActually pic.twitter.com/7XhGbDgBqn
— Red Nose Day (@rednoseday) March 7, 2017
But will Lincoln's second stalking wooing attempt be successful?
Well, it doesn't look like it. Freud also shared a photo of Knightley and Chiwetel Ejiofor sat side-by-side on a sofa with the caption "marital bliss".
Last night, our last night on #rednosedayactually . Marital bliss, the best pyjama bottoms I've ever seen, and major #jerseyenvy #shallow pic.twitter.com/Zk8bDkCrYn
— emma freud (@emmafreud) March 8, 2017
Unless that's sarcasm, it looks like Lincoln's character will be staying out in the cold.
